Although he is considered Saduq (reliable but prone to errors), using 'an without specifying whether the narration was before or after his confusion weakens the chain. His narrations were acceptable earlier in his life but questionable afterward.
Abu al-Hasan is of unknown reliability (Majhul al-Hal). His identity and character are not documented, which is a significant weakness in the chain.
The chain uses multiple 'an transmissions without explicit hearing claims, increasing ambiguity about the actual connections between narrators.
This is a mawquf narration that stops at Ibn Abbas and does not reach the Prophet ﷺ.
